critique: The document is a formal announcement regarding the designation of the Department of Justice as the Central Authority for the Convention on the Taking of Evidence Abroad. The tone is formal and legalistic. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and assurance that the United States is fulfilling its international obligations.
